content.description: Sit start on ledge under "tortoise head" overhang on L side of boulder. Climb up the arete squeezing the prow to top.
content.location: Tortoise boulder, just west of American Beauty.

content.description: This problem strangely resembles Slappin' the Captain but is much easier and less fun.
content.location:
Just to the West of American Beauty boulder is a big, North-facing tortoise head shaped rock. 

  Sit start on the right side of the head, go under it and up the East face.

content.description: A silly, awkward sit start becomes a fun but short problem.
content.location: In the middle of the West face of the Tortoise boulder, sit start in the small alcove and pull through the bulge topping out straight up.

content.description: Tricky.  Much fun and a little spooky up high.  To add two grades and a lot of terrain, sit start way left and traverse through terrapin station, then finish up the arete.
content.location: On the right-hand side of the West face, sit start just left of the arete and go up to it.  Follow it to the top.

content.description: "I actually tore a hamstring completely in half on it, it still is missing thanks to Dr. 'Quack'. Upon hearing my hamstring break (it sounded like a very large finger tendon breaking) Nathaniel exclaimed `That was the loudest sound I have ever heard produced by the human body, it actually made my ears hurt.`" -Peck
content.location:
Down the hill a bit from American Beauty boulder is this tiny roof. 

  Sit start on the right-hand side and use body tension to get to the left.  Go up the technical face.  Other variations of this are in the boulder guide.

content.description: Start on same sloper as American Beauty. Move out left to a pocket, then up the face to a tricky top.
content.location: Left side of the American Beauty boulder.

climbs.name: The Little Red Crystals in my Kidneys

content.description:
What is that red stuff? 

  Sustained and crimpy, and you get to pull on the red stuff.
content.location:
See the American Beauty picture and description. 

  Sit start a few feet to the right of American Beauty.  A lot of odd moves get you into crystal territory, then straight up to finish.

content.description: Tenuous sloper pulling over a thought-provoking landing.
content.location: To the West of American Beauty and the Tortoise, this problem has a lightbulb simulcra on it.  Sit start below the bulb and crank over it.

content.description:
Crux is up high so watch your ankles! 

  A stellar line anywhere.  Powerful moves lead to delicate moves lead to an exciting crux leads to a juggy finish. 

  Sit start has been done, adds some difficulty (V9-ish) but detracts from the quality.
content.protection: pads and spotters.  The big rock has hurt many an ankle.
content.location:
The big red overhang, past the warm up rock, up the hill from Slappin' the Captain, and immediately to the East of the Tortoise boulder.  I need an overview topo for the Alf Rig area... 

  Anyway, stand start on two slopers kind of on the left side of the overhang, use the undercling to gain the slick ledge.  Dive right to the weakness on the lip and pull around and up to the jugs.

content.description:
A low-density, high-quality bouldering spot.  More slopers than the usual Box fare. 

  North-facing and very exposed to wind and weather.
